definition: to draw a lesson (from a setback)
to think of danger in times of safety/to be vigilant in peacetime (idiom)
Fall into the moat and you'll be wiser next time (idiom); One only learns from one's mistakes.
pinyin: chi1 yi1 qian4 , zhang3 yi1 zhi4

definition: to be alert
to learn from history (idiom)
variant of 警戒[jing3 jie4]/to warn
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
to nip in the bud (idiom)
lit. to punish those before to prevent those after (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent them happening again
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)

definition: to observe the past to foresee the future (idiom, taken loosely from Book of Songs); studying ancient wisdom gives insight into what is to come
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom

lit. water may keep the boat afloat but may also sink it (proverb)/fig. the people can support a regime or overturn it/if sth is used properly, one can benefit from it, otherwise it can do harm/things can be double-edged
